newsitem.title: UK: Euro fuel oil broadly steady, low sulphur bid high.
newsitem.headline: Euro fuel oil broadly steady, low sulphur bid high.

text.p: European fuel oil prices were broadly steady in thin pre-weekend trade with markets still unimpressed by crude oil's strength, traders said.
Poor bunker demand and aggressive selling by one refiner in Rotterdam pushed high sulpur barge prices down $1 to sit at $80/$81 fob a tonne, the bottom end of the last two months' range.
Solid flows of Russian cracked fuel from St.Petersburg began to weigh on the ARA barge market, traders said, while refinery run cuts were unlikely to ease the pressure of over-supply for some time.
Low sulphur was supported by one bid in the market at $97 fob a tonne from a trader but there was no prompt supply available to meet it.
"Its very easy to bid high when you know the cargo is not there but I think the bidder would actually buy at that number if the material was there," said one supplier.

A cargo of low sulphur straight-run was heard sold quietly out of Scandinavia on Thursday for a price believed to be around $109-$110 a tonne fob. Sellers were originally hoping to achieve better than the $110 mark but buying interest softened to prevent it.
Russian straight-run cargoes were scarce and commanding good premiums.
